description:
Borrowed from Middle French docile, from Latin docilis, from docere (“teach”).
Compare Spanish dócil ("docile").

adjectives.description: docile (comparative more docile, superlative most docile)

entries.meaning: Ready to accept instruction or direction; obedient; subservient.
Yielding to control or supervision, direction, or management.
examples: Such literature may well be anathema to those, who are too docile and petty for their own good.
